seed.description: Seed identifier: either Table:ID or an ID with a known prefix (e.g., LEADER_*)
seed.name: seed

data:crawl.description:
Given a root folder (or single XML file) and a seed (e.g., LEADER_*, TRAIT_*, or Table:ID),
this command builds an in-memory index of Civ-style XML and performs a breadth-first crawl
to discover related rows. It writes a graph (JSON + DOT) and a manifest of XML files.

root.description: Override root folder (XML dir) if not using config
root.name: root

data:crawl.summary: Crawl Civ XML resources and output a dependency graph + manifest

seed.description: Seed identifier: Table:ID or an ID with a known prefix (e.g., LEADER_*)
seed.name: seed

data:explore.description: Runs the full pipeline: crawl resources for a seed, emit graph.json/graph.dot, render SVG, and optionally open a visualizer (local SVG or Graphviz Online).

root.description: Override root folder (XML dir) if not using config
root.name: root

open.description: Open the generated visualization (HTML viewer by default) in your default browser
open.name: open

openOnline.description: Open GraphvizOnline with DOT in the URL hash (may be too long for big graphs)
openOnline.name: openOnline

maxUrlLength.description: Max URL length for online viewer (guard)
maxUrlLength.name: maxUrlLength

vizHtml.description: Emit a local HTML viewer (graph.html) that embeds the generated SVG and adds pan/zoom
vizHtml.name: vizHtml

serve.description: Serve the output directory and open http://localhost:<port>/graph.html
serve.name: serve

data:explore.summary: Crawl + render + open a visualization in one pipeline.

input.description: Path to DOT file (defaults to out/<seed>/graph.dot)
input.name: input

output.description: Path to output SVG (defaults to out/<seed>/graph.svg)
output.name: output

data:render.description: Renders a Graphviz DOT file to SVG using a WebAssembly Graphviz engine.
data:render.summary: Render a Graphviz DOT file to an SVG (no external deps).

data:slice.description:
Reads a manifest.txt (one absolute path per line) and copies those files from a given root into a destination folder,
preserving relative directory structure.

root.description: Override root directory (XML source) if not using config
root.name: root

data:slice.summary: Copy files from manifest.txt into a destination folder (preserving paths).

profile.description: The profile to use from the config file.
profile.name: profile

zipfile.description: Overrides the source path for the zip archive.
zipfile.name: zipfile

extractpath.description: Overrides the output directory for extraction.
extractpath.name: extractpath

data:unzip.description:
Reads profiles from the CLI config to extract a resource archive.
The source zip file and extraction path are determined by the profile, but can be overridden.
data:unzip.summary: Unzips Civilization VII resources based on a profile.

profile.description: The profile to use from the config file.
profile.name: profile

zipfile.description: Overrides the output path for the zip archive.
zipfile.name: zipfile

data:zip.description:
Reads profiles from the CLI config to create a zip archive of the game's resources.
Automatically detects OS defaults but can be overridden. Supports include/exclude patterns and prints a summary.

verbose.description: Enables verbose output from the zip command.
verbose.name: verbose

data:zip.summary: Zips Civilization VII resources based on a profile.

docs:serve.description:
Synchronizes documentation resources from central outputs (if available) and serves the Mintlify site.

  By default, serves the directory apps/docs under the project root. You can override with --siteDir.

siteDir.description: Path to docs directory (Mintlify: apps/docs, Docsify: apps/docs/site)
siteDir.name: siteDir

open.description: Open the server URL in your default browser
open.name: open

skipSync.description: Skip syncing documentation resources before serving
skipSync.name: skipSync

docs:serve.summary: Serve the Mintlify documentation (apps/docs) with synced resources.

mod:config.description: Add or update the git remote used by mods/<slug>.

remoteName.description: Git remote name (defaults from config or slug)
remoteName.name: remoteName

autoUnshallow.description: Automatically unshallow the repo if needed
autoUnshallow.name: autoUnshallow

mod:deploy.description: Copies files from an input directory into Mods/[mod-id].

input.description: Input directory of the mod files
input.name: input

id.description: Target mod id (directory name under Mods/)
id.name: id

mod:deploy.summary: Deploy a mod folder into the Civ7 Mods directory

mod:import.description: Preserve history by adding the remote as a subtree under mods/<slug>.

remoteName.description: Git remote name (defaults from config or slug)

autoUnshallow.description: Automatically unshallow the repo if needed
autoUnshallow.name: autoUnshallow

remoteName.description: Git remote name (defaults from config or slug)
remoteName.name: remoteName

autoUnshallow.name: autoUnshallow

overwrite.description: Overwrite existing subtree directory if non-empty
overwrite.name: overwrite

mod:list.summary: List locally installed Civ7 mods in the Mods directory
